/** * When using the {@link java.net.InetAddress#getHostName()} method in an * environment where neither a proper DNS lookup nor an /etc/hosts * entry exists for a given host, the following exception will be thrown: *

* * java.net.UnknownHostException: <.hostname>.: <.hostname>. * at java.net.InetAddress.getLocalHost(InetAddress.java:1425) * ... * *

* Instead of just throwing an UnknownHostException and giving up, this * method grabs a suitable hostname from the exception and prevents the * exception from being thrown. If a suitable hostname cannot be acquired * from the exception, only then is the UnknownHostException thrown. * * @return the hostname * @throws UnknownHostException is thrown if hostname could not be resolved */ public static String getLocalHostName() throws UnknownHostException { try { return (InetAddress.getLocalHost()).getHostName(). } catch (UnknownHostException uhe) { // host = "hostname: hostname" String host = uhe.getMessage(). if (host != null) { int colon = host.indexOf(':'). if (colon > 0) { return host.substring(0, colon). } } throw uhe. } }
